page.title: 01INTRO TO THE CLAYBROOKE AREA
page.content: . The area we have been studying covers one village and parts of three others. The main village Claybrooke Magna, known as Great, Nether,or Lower Claybrooke; Claybrooke Parva (Little, Over, or Upper Claybrooke;Frolesworth, and Ullesthorpe. Leafy green Claybrooke Parva has the church and school whilst Claybrooke Magna, "the working village" has the timber yard with saw mill, a post office three shops and two public houses. Frolesworth, "a village of walls", behind which are some large houses and once described as a village of rich farmers, has its own church.In Ullesthorpe there is "The Court" a restaurant with an 18-hole golf course.
